meanings.definition: Pressure or tension exerted on a material object
meanings.sent1: The heavy box put a lot of stress on the table.
meanings.sent2: The bridge collapsed under the stress of the strong winds.
meanings.sent3: The stress of the books on the shelf made it lean to one side.
meanings.sent4: The stress on the rope caused it to snap suddenly.
meanings.sent5: The stress of the water against the dam was immense.

meanings.definition: A state of mental or emotional strain or tension resulting from adverse or demanding circumstances
meanings.sent1: She felt a lot of stress before her big exam.
meanings.sent2: The stress of the situation made him anxious.
meanings.sent3: The stress of waiting for the results was unbearable.
meanings.sent4: The stress of the argument lingered in the air.
meanings.sent5: The stress of the deadline weighed heavily on her mind.

meanings.definition: Emphasize (a particular syllable, word, or phrase) when speaking or reading
meanings.sent1: Remember to stress the important points in your speech.
meanings.sent2: She tends to stress certain words when she talks.
meanings.sent3: He would stress the punchline of the joke for effect.
meanings.sent4: The teacher asked the students to stress the vowels in the word.
meanings.sent5: It's important to stress the key details in your presentation.
